title: Hurts unfazed by reports Eagles frustrated with QB
content: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts, responding to recent reports that some players have grown frustrated with his play, said he'll "never run away" from holding himself accountable.

title: Braves retain Iglesias, deal for Gold Glover Dubon
content: The Braves retained veteran closer Raisel Iglesias on a one-year, $16 million deal and acquired two-time Gold Glove winner Mauricio Dubon from the Astros.

title: Lamar on injury report again, this time for ankle
content: For the second straight week, Lamar Jackson didn't practice for the Ravens on Wednesday. This time, the two-time NFL MVP is listed with an ankle injury.

title: Rodgers: Playing status will be 'a safety thing'
content: To play Sunday against the Bears, Steelers quarterback Aaron Rodgers said he has to be able to "protect" himself.

title: Jets' Boyd: 'Starting to breathe on my own now'
content: Jets cornerback Kris Boyd, who was shot in the abdomen early Sunday morning outside a Manhattan restaurant, is now in stable condition and "starting to breathe on my own now," he said Wednesday.

title: Terps land Oladotun, Williams' 1st 5-star since '17
content: Babatunde Oladotun, ranked No. 8 in the SC Next 100 for the class of 2026, committed to Maryland on Wednesday, giving coach Buzz WIlliams his first five-star recruit in nearly a decade.

title: Top seeds now set for World Cup draw, playoffs
content: The top-seeded teams for the Dec. 5 World Cup tournament draw, including Germany but not Croatia, were set Wednesday when FIFA published new rankings.

title: Panthers say Luostarinen out after BBQ 'mishap'
content: Panthers forward Eetu Luostarinen is out indefinitely after what coach Paul Maurice described as a "barbecuing mishap."

content: Alessia Russo boasts many qualities, but her brace vs. Real Madrid showed just how valuable she is as Arsenal's primary goal threat.

content: There are still 64 national teams that can win the FIFA World Cup next summer. Let's go through them all and rank where they stand.

content: The Buffalo Bills' MVP is one rushing TD away from becoming the NFL's all-time leader in rushing TDs by a QB. Will he get it Thursday?

content: Bad Bunny's Super Bowl set drawing buzz, but search data shows which halftime shows stood the test of time.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Adeyemi would prefer Arsenal move over Man United
content: Manchester United have discussed Dortmund's Karim Adeyemi, but the forward prefers Arsenal. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Bengaluru heist: Gang posing as ‚ÄòRBI officials‚Äô loot Rs 7cr from cash van in 30 mins ‚Äî how the drama unfolded
content: Five to six miscreants, posing as RBI officials, executed a daring daylight dacoity in Bengaluru, looting Rs 7.1 crore from an armoured cash van. The well-scripted incident involved blocking the van, deceiving its staff, and making off with the cash boxes under the guise of an inspection.

title: 'Why are you in Congress?' Sandeep Dikshit slams Tharoor over PM Modi praise
content: Shashi Tharoor's recent praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi has sparked internal dissent within the Congress. Colleagues like Sandeep Dikshit and Supriya Shrinate have questioned Tharoor's remarks, with Dikshit even calling him a "hypocrite" and questioning his loyalty to the party. Tharoor, however, highlighted Modi's speech on economic outlook and national pride.

title: 'He asked, we agreed': Trump to meet NYC mayor Zohran Mamdani ‚Äî what's on agenda?
content: New York City's mayor-elect, Zohran "Kwame" Mamdani, is set to meet President Donald Trump at the Oval Office on November 21st. Despite past public clashes and differing political ideologies, Mamdani aims to discuss New York's affordability crisis. He emphasizes a willingness to cooperate for the city's benefit while opposing harmful federal actions.

title: No. 3 or not to be? Ganguly says Sundar not suited - 'Must be specialists'
content: Former India captain Sourav Ganguly expressed doubts about Washington Sundar's suitability for the No. 3 batting position in Test cricket. Ganguly believes specialist batters are crucial for the top five, especially in challenging overseas conditions like England, Australia, and South Africa, suggesting Sundar might struggle in such environments.

title: US power meet: Trump says ‚Äòwe have biggest business leaders‚Äô; Musk returns to White House
content: Elon Musk made his first public White House appearance since a public feud, attending a dinner hosted by President Trump alongside other tech leaders. This signals a potential thawing of tensions following a dispute over a fiscal package. The event coincided with a significant data center deal between Musk's xAI and Saudi Arabia.

title: Sent by alien civilisation? Nasa clears the air on interstellar comet 3I/ATLAS ‚Äî images out
content: Nasa on Wednesday released long-delayed images of Comet 3I/ATLAS, an interstellar visitor that stayed hidden during the 43-day US government shutdown, sparking online claims of alien links. Senior officials dismissed the rumours, saying it behaves like a normal comet. The new photographs from multiple spacecraft will help build a clearer 3D view before it exits deep space.

title: ‚ÄòMentally harassed by teachers‚Äô: Class 10 boy jumps to death from Delhi metro station; note recovered
content: A Class 10 student tragically died by suicide after allegedly facing harassment from teachers. His father filed a case, naming a teacher and three others for mental torment. A suicide note revealed the boy's wish for action against those who troubled him, wanting to prevent others from similar suffering. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Under mounting pressure: Trump signs bill to release Epstein files
content: President Trump signed the Epstein Files Transparency Act, mandating the Justice Department to release all files related to Jeffrey Epstein. The bill passed overwhelmingly in both the House and Senate. Trump asserted that the files will reveal truths about Democrats associated with Epstein, while the Biden administration allegedly withheld information.

title: Canada‚Äôs big bet on space: ESA funding soars over tenfold; Trump tariffs cited as reason
content: Canada is significantly boosting its investment in European Space Agency programs by tenfold, committing CA$528.5 million. This strategic move aims to diversify the nation's economy, strengthen European ties, and reduce reliance on the US for military equipment and exports. The partnership promises substantial returns for Canadian businesses and job creation.

title: Gurgaon housing scam: ED arrests Lalu Prasad Yadav aide Amit Katya
content: Amit Katyal, once an ally of former Railway Minister Lalu Prasad Yadav, finds himself in legal trouble again as the ED apprehends him for alleged fraud in a housing project targeting homebuyers in Gurgaon.

title: PIOs among the wealthy fleeing UK for lower tax countries
content: Wealthy British Indians are relocating from the UK. High taxes and declining public services are driving this exodus. Entrepreneurs and skilled professionals are considering moves to countries like Dubai and India. Concerns about future tax policies are a significant factor. This trend highlights a growing dissatisfaction with the UK's economic climate and governance.

title: Ashes: 'Only designed for this'- Ponting says Bazball was forged for this series
content: Ricky Ponting believes England's 'Bazball' approach was specifically crafted for the current Ashes series in Australia. He suggests the team's aggressive batting style, honed over two years under Brendon McCullum and Ben Stokes, is designed to counter Australian conditions. Ponting drew parallels to England's 2019 ODI World Cup preparation, emphasizing a consistent squad and strategy.

title: Tech firm whose founder beat Musk as world's richest for a day loses 30% market value
content: Larry Ellison briefly surpassed Elon Musk in wealth after Oracle's stock surged on a massive OpenAI cloud deal. However, Oracle's value has since plummeted, erasing those gains and pushing Ellison down the rankings. Musk has since reclaimed his top spot, driven by strong performance in Tesla and SpaceX.

title: Top shares to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Deputy Vice President, Aakash K Hindocha, recommends buying LIC, Bharat Forge, and HUDCO. He anticipates Nifty reaching new all-time highs and Bank Nifty continuing its upward trend.

title: Bihar results: EC dataset defies assumptions; 4 of 5 seats with max & min SIR deletions won by NDA
content: While women's turnout significantly boosted the NDA's Bihar victory, AIMIM secured three of the top five seats with highest female participation. The special revision exercise's impact on poll outcomes showed mixed results, with NDA winning a proportional share of seats affected by deletions and additions.

title: Hailee Steinfeld mocked as outfit sparks pregnancy rumors among NFL fans
content: Hailee Steinfeld's sculptural St√©phane Rolland gown at the 2025 Governors Awards sparked widespread pregnancy speculation online. The dress's exaggerated silhouette, particularly the structured waist, led fans to theorize it was designed to conceal a baby bump. Steinfeld has not commented on the rumors, instead sharing details about hosting Thanksgiving with Josh Allen.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs new song sparks Joe Alwyn breakup buzz, not Travis Kelce
content: Taylor Swift's new song, 'The Fate of Ophelia,' is fueling fan theories linking it to her breakup with Joe Alwyn.  Swifties interpret lyrics about rescue and rebirth as a nod to her current relationship, contrasting it with her past. The track is seen as Taylor Swift reclaiming her narrative, transforming heartbreak into art.

title: Video sparks allegations of Trevon Diggs‚Äô role in violent elevator encounter
content: Surveillance footage has surfaced regarding an elevator altercation in Los Angeles, allegedly involving individuals connected to the Diggs family. While Trevon Diggs isn't officially charged, a civil suit names him, and his brother Darez has faced legal action. The victim claims robbery and assault, sparking intense scrutiny.

title: Building AGI is ‚Äòanti-goal‚Äô: Microsoft AI CEO issues warning; claims 'it will be hard to control'
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges caution against developing artificial superintelligence (ASI), deeming it an "anti-goal" due to control and alignment risks. Instead, his team focuses on "humanist superintelligence" to support human interests. This contrasts with figures like OpenAI's Sam Altman, who sees ASI as a key goal for accelerating discovery and prosperity.

title: Trump berates one reporter and tells another,‚ÄòQuiet! Quiet, piggy!‚Äô
content: President Trump escalated tensions with the press, directing a crude insult at a female journalist and threatening to revoke a network's license. These confrontations, including calling a reporter "piggy" and a network "fake news," align with his documented pattern of using gendered slurs to deflect from tough questions and undermine female critics.

title: Delhi blast: CCTV shows 'bomber' Dr Umar spent 3 hours near Sunehri Masjid before explosion
content: Investigators are probing three key mysteries surrounding the Nov 10 suicide bombing near Red Fort: the assembly location of the IED, the detonation method, and contact with the bomber's handler. Evidence suggests the device may have been finalized at a parking lot near Sunehri Masjid. Analysis of recovered materials also reveals plans for drone and rocket attacks.

title: Candace Owens drops bombshell on Charlie Kirk ‚Äòassassination‚Äô and Tyler Robinson twist
content: Candace Owens questions the official narrative surrounding Charlie Kirk's shooting, suggesting a planned setup involving multiple individuals. She claims Tyler Robinson's role was limited, with his fingerprints not being the only ones on the weapon. Owens also alleges Lance Twiggs played a more significant, albeit different, part in the incident, citing a TMZ video as evidence.

title: 'Fear driving J&K-registered vehicle': CM says 'all Kashmiris being defamed'; slams govt on security
content: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah expressed concern that Kashmiris are being viewed with suspicion across India due to the actions of a few. He stated that stripping the region of its special status and statehood has not ended bloodshed, questioning those responsible for security about the current situation.

title: SC: 3 talaqs sent through lawyer not valid
content: The Supreme Court questioned the validity of Muslim men authorizing lawyers to issue triple talaq notices, stating it's not a valid divorce without the husband's signature. The bench emphasized that such practices cannot harm Muslim women's dignity and will not permit unauthorized divorce notifications.

title: 'Unconstitutional': Supreme Court strikes down Tribunal Act; slams government
content: The Supreme Court has declared the Tribunal Reforms Act unconstitutional, criticizing the government's repeated attempts to undermine tribunal independence. A bench led by CJI Gavai found the Act to be a near-replica of a previously struck-down ordinance, violating separation of powers and judicial independence. This ruling emphasizes constitutional supremacy over parliamentary discretion.

title: Indiabulls case: SC raps CBI; questions ‚Äòfriendly‚Äô probe
content: The Supreme Court criticized the CBI's "friendly and cool" approach in probing Indiabulls Housing Finance's financial irregularities. The court questioned the corporate affairs ministry's decision to close Sebi and ED-flagged governance issues, emphasizing the need for a thorough investigation into multi-layered transactions and loan round-tripping.

title: Is LaMelo Ball playing tonight vs Pacers? Injury update on Hornets star
content: LaMelo Ball is active for the Charlotte Hornets' game against the Indiana Pacers on November 19, 2025, following a right ankle impingement. Despite other key injuries, Ball's return is crucial as the Hornets lean on him to lead their offense. His history against the Pacers suggests a strong scoring performance is likely.

title: 'Vote chori': Prominent citizens hit out at Rahul; Cong challenges letter writers to question EC
content: Prominent citizens have written an open letter criticizing Rahul Gandhi. They accuse him of attacking the Election Commission's dignity with 'impotent rage' and 'unsubstantiated accusations' following electoral failures.  Congress has challenged the letter writers, questioning the Election Commission's electoral rolls. The exchange highlights ongoing political debate surrounding electoral processes.

title: Dharmendra health update: Veteran actor ‚Äòdoing better than earlier‚Äô as he recovers at home
content: Veteran actor Dharmendra, who was discharged from Mumbai‚Äôs Breach Candy Hospital a week ago, is ‚Äúdoing better than earlier.‚Äù The 89-year-old star was reportedly admitted to the hospital a few days before October 31 after experiencing breathlessness.

title: Simone Biles‚ÄìJonathan Owens timeline: Key moments that shaped their love story
content: Gymnast Simone Biles and NFL player Jonathan Owens' love story blossomed from an online match during the pandemic. Their relationship, marked by mutual respect and support, led to a proposal in 2022 and two wedding celebrations in 2023. Their journey highlights the power of trust and communication in elite sports.

title: Who is Nadia Comaneci? Olympic icon‚Äôs bold message on trans inclusion in sports
content: Gymnastics legend Nadia Comaneci, celebrated for her historic perfect 10s, has voiced her stance on transgender athletes in women's sports, stating, ‚Äúwomen‚Äôs sports are for women.‚Äù Her comments, following recent global discussions and incidents like the Imane Khelif case, underscore a growing debate on fairness and inclusion in competitive athletics.

title: Who was Randy Jones? Former San Diego Padres pitcher dies at 75
content: Former San Diego Padres pitcher Randy Jones, the 1976 National League Cy Young Award winner, has passed away at 75. Known for his quick pace and strong control, Jones led the league with 22 wins in 1976 and was a two-time All-Star. His impactful career and mentorship left a lasting legacy on the Padres and the broader baseball community.

title: F-35s, AI chips, and trillions: How MBS, once a ‚Äòpariah‚Äô, took back Washington
content: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, once a pariah, has made a remarkable comeback in Washington, securing significant US investment and military hardware.  His visit, marked by military fanfare and high-profile meetings, underscores Saudi Arabia's renewed strategic importance to the US, despite lingering human rights concerns. MBS skillfully leveraged geopolitical competition to his advantage.

title: Unjustified! Why Trump should now withdraw 25% Russian oil tariffs on India - explained
content: GTRI has urged the Trump administration to immediately lift the 25% tariff on Indian crude oil imports from Russia. Citing India's substantial reduction in Russian oil purchases and increased energy trade with the US, the GTRI argues the original rationale for the surcharge no longer applies.

title: Pakistan Asia's second best team? Sikandar Raza gives 'African' answer; flips script
content: Zimbabwe captain Sikandar Raza deflected a reporter's question about Asian T20 team rankings, stating his focus is solely on his national team. He asserted Zimbabwe's position as the second-best team in Africa. Raza also suggested that reaching the tri-series final might be considered an upset by some.

title: 'Fatwa issued': BJP defends Tharoor for PM praise; takes 'Nazi' jab at Cong
content: BJP slammed Congress for criticising Shashi Tharoor's praise of PM Modi's speech, dubbing the party 'Indira Nazi Congress' for its 'emergency mindset' and discouraging internal dissent. While Tharoor lauded Modi's focus on development and cultural heritage, Congress spokesperson Supriya Shrinate found the address unimpressive and questioned Tharoor's appreciation.

title: No neck brace for Shubman Gill! Team IND arrive in Guwahati - watch
content: India captain Shubman Gill arrived in Guwahati without his neck brace, signaling encouraging recovery from his injury sustained during the Kolkata Test. While his participation in the second Test against South Africa remains uncertain, the management will make a late decision.  The team has secured ample cover with drafted-in players and available reserves.

title: Boosting credit profile 101: Struggling with low credit score? This 2-3-4 rule will help
content: Applying for too many credit cards at once can harm your credit score. The 2-3-4 rule suggests limiting applications to two within 30 days, three in a year, and four in two years. This approach helps manage spending, avoid fees, and build a stronger credit profile over time.

title: From ‚ÄúDoo Doo Doo‚Äù to dollars: How Baby Shark made $400 million
content: A South Korean startup, Pinkfong, transformed from a small digital-content company into a multi-million dollar enterprise, largely driven by the viral success of the children's song 'Baby Shark'. Despite initial humble beginnings and legal challenges, the company has expanded its offerings and aims to prove its continued relevance beyond its biggest hit.

title: The threat of digital tradecraft in terrorism | Explained
content: A car explosion near Delhi‚Äôs Red Fort on November 10, killing at least 15 people and injuring over 30, has revealed the use of advanced digital tradecraft in terrorist attacks. This is a sobering reminder that the next frontier in counter-terrorism is not just on the physical terrain, but also in encrypted, and deeply private digital spaces

title: Presidential Reference verdict LIVE: SC to give opinion on timeline for President, Governors for Bills' Assent
content: In September, the CJI Gavai-led Bench had made it clear that the Centre should not expect it to ‚Äúsit idle‚Äù and powerless if a constitutional authority failed to discharge his duties

title: New department to connect global Rajasthani diaspora with State‚Äôs progress
content: The department would lay down a policy framework to extend the benefits of the government‚Äôs schemes to NRRs and strengthen their relations with the State, Rajasthan Minister Rajyavardhan Singh Rathore said

content: The system involves installation of unique QR codes in all the catering stalls;¬†by scanning the QR code passengers are provided with essential details of the stall‚Äôs location and the station code

content: The delegation, led by Andhra Pradesh Governor Justice S. Abdul Nazeer, arrived in Madina, the Indian Embassy in Riyadh said

title: System constraints holding back probes into cyber attacks: Digital experts
content: India‚Äôs loss due to cyber fraud in 2024 surged 205.6% from 2023, cybersecurity experts said at a national conference in Gauhati University

content: The petition challenges BMC‚Äôs interim move to allow controlled pigeon feeding at¬†Airoli-Mulund¬†creekside, citing health hazards and ecological risks.¬†¬†

title: Uttar Pradesh Education Commission faces uproar over repeated delays of TGT examination
content: Aspirants raised concerns that it was the fifth time the examination has been postponed, adding the government system is playing with future of lakhs of candidates, who are jobless and facing a bleak future wasting prime years in the hope of government jobs

title: Shia community representatives demand ticket in BMC election or will vote NOTA
content: The Mumbai Shia Youth Brigade has also written to all political parties on November 16, 2025, raising concerns regarding civic and religious matters

title: The Hindu journalists win Laadli awards for gender-sensitive reportage
content: Reports on the rape and murder of a doctor in R.G. Kar Hospital in Kolkata and a feature on transgender welfare bag accolades

title: Mallika Sarabhai‚Äôs ‚Äòshifting cities‚Äô act set for Hyderabad stage on November 21
content: The performance, she says, is called ‚ÄòMeanwhile, Elsewhere‚Äô and is inspired by Italio Calvino‚Äôs book¬†Invisible Cities,¬†one of her favourite books

title: Red Fort blast: doctors with foreign degrees come under police scrutiny
content: Officials said both government and private healthcare facilities have been asked¬†to provide comprehensive information on medical staff who obtained qualifications abroad, specifically degrees from Pakistan, Bangladesh, the UAE and China

title: Hidden cost of polluted groundwater
content: India needs a nationwide, real-time groundwater monitoring system with open access to data so communities know what they are drinking and irrigating with

title: Courts take cognisance of the offence, not of the offenders: Madras High Court
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohamed Shaffiq reject a revision petition filed by an accused in a ‚Çπ1,301 crore bank loan misappropriation case

title: Watch: What the NDA victory means for Bihar‚Äôs economy ‚Äî and its fiscal discipline | Business Matters
content: The NDA alliance swept the polls in Biahr. What will this mean for Bihar‚Äôs economy in the coming months? It‚Äôs highly likely we will notice what is now a pattern across States. Not just Bihar but most other States in India see some slippage when it comes to fiscal discipline. Here‚Äôs a peek into how this happens.

title: Stalemate over third round of counselling of MBBS, BDS courses continues as Karnataka High Court delivers divergent verdict on KEA‚Äôs procedure
content: The petitions, filed by some of the candidates challenging the procedure of allotment in the third round, will be heard by a third judge and till then the counselling process for 900 seats will be on hold

title: Karnataka government to train women who‚Äôve taken career breaks in semiconductor industry
content: The training programme is mostly designed for women who have taken a career break and still want to get back to work after a sabbatical of some years

title: U.P. ATS seeks details on madrassas; opposition alleges fear mongering
content: The inquiry has been criticised by opposition parties who allege attempts are being made to politicise security and portray every Muslim as a suspect

title: L&T to produce armoured vehicle BvS10 Sindhu for Indian Army at Hazira facility
content: The contract also includes a comprehensive integrated logistics support package for initial deployment, maintenance, and life-cycle sustainment, L&T said in a filing to BSE

title: Bombay HC slams Maharashtra govt for inaction on illegal constructions
content: Court terms mushrooming of illegal buildings a ‚Äògrave concern‚Äô, warns State against being a passive spectator as homebuyers suffer.¬†

title: Taliban‚Äôs trade Minister in Delhi amidst Afghanistan-Pakistan clashes to enhance sea connectivity
content: Alhaj Nooruddin Azizi has come with a large business delegation to strengthen bilateral trade and investment; India is keen on importing Afghan agriculture produce and minerals

title: Karnataka govt. notifies ward delimitation for five Bengaluru city corporations
content: The final notification revises the draft proposal, which suggested 368 wards, and raises the number to 369 by adding one more ward to the Bengaluru West City Corporation

title: Days after delivering death sentence for former PM Hasina, Bangladesh invites NSA Doval to visit Dhaka
content: Doval will host his counterparts from Maldives, Mauritius, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh at the Colombo Security Conclave, the Ministry of External Affairs said in an announcement

title: The forgotten 316 families in Kochi: victims of development speak out
content: The acquisition of land for ICTT connectivity displaced 316 families across seven villages spanning three Assembly constituencies and six local bodies in Ernakulam

title: ED attaches assets worth ‚Çπ11.26 crore in cyber fraud case
content: It was alleged that syndicate members targeted foreign nationals by posing as law enforcement officials and extorted huge amounts from them on the threat of arresting them or freezing their bank accounts

title: Mumbai Congress meets Sharad Pawar to discuss alliance for BMC polls
content: This comes after Congress expressed its wish to run elections independently in the Municipal Corporation elections in Mumbai, and Shiv Sena (UBT) advised it to introspect on its decision

content: The accused operated mainly from Delhi and¬†Noida, and placed large-scale advertisements on online and social media platforms promising medical admissions in reputed institutions across Indi

title: SC declines quota for promotee judges in Higher Judicial Service
content: SC says there is no disproportionate representation of direct recruits in the higher judiciary that hurts promotees; cannot create artificial classification of members within a cadre, it says

title: Hyderabad launches ‚ÄòSenior Saathi‚Äô to foster companionship between youth and elderly
content: Programme designed against backdrop of rapid social change, where shifting family structures and migration have left many elderly persons with fewer opportunities for regular social interaction

title: ED facilitates release of assets to victims in Rotomac Global case
content: The ED probe is based on a FIR registered by the Central Bureau of Investigation, alleging that the company cheated the Bank of Baroda to the tune of ‚Çπ456.38 crore

content: Health Minister asks the university to release such a list after complaints over the final list for admission; university blames technical glitch for the confusion

content: SKM leaders say the draft seed Bill surrendered the seed sovereignty of India and it is aimed at predatory pricing by  corporate monopolies

content: He says poor waste collection and clogged drainages are among the main achievements of the ruling LDF and calls Congress the e ‚ÄòB‚Äô team of CPI(M)

title: Presidential Reference: Supreme Court verdict on November 20 on fixing timeline for President, Governors to clear bills
content: The President‚Äôs decision for Presidential Reference had come after the April 8 verdict of the apex court, on powers of the governor in dealing with bills passed by the Tamil Nadu government

title: CPI(M) to launch Bangla Bachao Yatra in West Bengal ahead of 2026 Assembly polls
content: The Bangla Bachao Yatra is likely to traverse across West Bengal from north to south.  The yatra will start at Tufanganj in Cooch Behar on November 29 and will conclude at Kamarhati in North 24 Parganas on December 17

title: Fact-finding team alleges brutal assault of prisoners in Viyyur High-Security Prison
content: It demands judicial inquiry into human rights violations inside Viyyur jail as well as other prisons in the State

title: Medina bus crash: Paperwork ahead of burial requires NOC from kin and DNA testing, says Telangana official
content: Bodies of the victims are currently placed in three different hospitals in Saudi Arabia, says Secretary for Minorities Welfare B. Shafiullah

title: Burials of Medina bus crash victims from Hyderabad likely on Friday: Azharuddin
content: The Telangana Minorities Welfare Minister says the government has sought burials at the revered Jannat-ul-Baqi for Hyderabad victims of the devastating bus-tanker collision in Medina that killed 45 Indian pilgrims

title: BJP, JD(S) leaders extend support as agitation enters 20th day in Koppal
content: BJP MLC Hemalatha Naik has said that she will raise the issue of Baldota iron ore mine expansion once again during the Winter Session

title: Employment under MGNREGS falls for second year in a row
content: Lib Tech tracker shows 11.7% fall in persondays in FY 2025-26; States such as Uttarakhand and Telangana see steep drops

title: Corpus fund of ‚Çπ1 crore will be set up in KSPCB : Siddaramaiah
content: An award will be instituted in the name of environmentalist Saalumarada Thimmakka who passed away recently

title: Nitish Kumar to take oath as Bihar CM for record 10th¬†time on Nov. 20 in presence of PM Modi
content: Earlier, in the day Mr. Kumar was unanimously elected as the NDA Legislature Party leader. Samrat Choudhary and Vijay Kumar Sinha also elected as leader and deputy leader of the BJP Legislature Party

title: US Approves Possible Sale Of Javelin Missile System To India At $46 Million
content: The United States has approved a possible sale of the Javelin Missile System and related equipment to India at an estimated cost of $45.7 million.

title: Elon Musk's 'Thank You' Note To Trump After "You Are So Lucky" Reminder
content: After a bitter fallout, US President Donald Trump and Elon Musk seem to be back to being 'buddies' after the Republican leader welcomed the billionaire businessman to the White House for dinner with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammad bin Salman.

title: "Communist New York Mayor Asked For It": Trump To Meet Mamdani Tomorrow
content: US President Donald Trump has said that New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani will meet him at the White House on Friday.

title: "Why In Congress If You Favour BJP?" Shashi Tharoor Under Fire Over PM Remark
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor continued to come under fire from his colleagues over his praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Ramnath Goenka Lecture.

title: Epstein Files: World's Biggest Sex Scandal Awaits Revelation With Trump Signing Key Bill
content: Bowing to political pressure, US President Donald Trump announced he has signed a bill that directs the Department of Justice to publicly release all files related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: US Peace Proposal To See Ukraine Ceding Land After Russian Strike Kills 26
content: A new US peace proposal would see Kyiv ceding land and more than halving its army, a source told AFP Wednesday, as a Russian strike in the west of Ukraine killed 26 people, including three children.

title: US Judge Revives Contempt Proceeding Against Trump Officials
content: US District Judge James Boasberg on Wednesday said he was resuming his long-stalled court proceeding to determine whether Trump administration officials willfully violated a court order by deporting hundreds of men to El Salvador in March.

title: Nitish Kumar 10.0 Oath In Bihar Today With NDA's Show Of Strength
content: JD(U) supremo Nitish Kumar is set to be sworn-in as Bihar chief minister for a record 10th time today, days after the NDA secured a landslide victory in the assembly elections.

title: Donald Trump To Elon Musk: Complete List Of People Named In Epstein Files
content: Lawmakers in both the House and Senate have ordered the US Justice Department to make public its files on convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Congress's Gaurav Gogoi's Big Voter List Charge Against Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Congress president Gaurav Gogoi launched a strong attack on Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, alleging that the state government was attempting to manipulate the electorate by adding voters from outside Assam ahead of the 2026 Assembly polls.

title: Turkey Set To Host COP31 Climate Summit As Deal With Australia Takes Shape
content: Turkey would host next year's UN climate summit while Australia would lead the conference's negotiations among governments, under a compromise deal that three sources familiar with the matter said was taking shape in talks on Thursday.

title: Saudi Arabia Lifts Travel Ban On US Citizen Over 2021 Critical Tweets
content: Saudi Arabia has lifted a travel ban on a US citizen who criticized the kingdom on social media, his family said Wednesday, as President Donald Trump welcomed the crown prince.

title: Trump Says He Would Now Work To "Stabilise" Sudan Conflict
content: Trump admitted that the devastating war between Sudan's army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF) was "not on my charts" before Prince Mohammed bin Salman pushed him to get involved.

title: 27 Killed In Fresh Israeli Strikes On Gaza
content: Israeli air strikes on Gaza killed 27 people Wednesday, officials in the Strip said, with Israel and Hamas each accusing the other of violating the fragile ceasefire in the Palestinian territory.

title: Meta To Remove Social Media Accounts Of Australians Under 16 By December 10
content: Australians younger than 16 will be removed from Facebook and Instagram on December 4, tech giant Meta said Thursday, as Canberra prepares to enforce sweeping laws banning teens from social media.

title: Nvidia Reports 'Off The Charts' Demand For AI Chips
content: Nvidia shares climbed Wednesday after it beat quarterly earnings expectations on fierce demand for its sophisticated chips for powering artificial intelligence.

title: Allowing Skilled Immigrants To Train US Workers "Is MAGA", Says Trump
content: President Donald Trump has made hardline immigration policies a signature issue, but acknowledged on Wednesday that he's been criticized for recently saying some skilled immigrants should be allowed into the country from his "MAGA" supporters.

title: What's Next Once Trump Signs Bill Releasing The Epstein Files
content: Congress is sending President Donald Trump a bill to compel the Justice Department to make public its case files on the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Epstein Files Will Be Released Within 30 Days: US Attorney General
content: The US Justice Department will release files from its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein within 30 days, Attorney General Pam Bondi said on Wednesday, after Congress voted nearly unanimously to force the Trump administration to make them public.

title: Afghanistan Turns To India For Trade Expansion In Sharp Snub To Pakistan
content: Afghanistan's Minister of Industry and Commerce, Alhaj Nooruddin Azizi, arrived in New Delhi on November 19 for a five-day official visit, signalling one of the strongest diplomatic and economic engagements between India and Taliban administrations.

title: Bottom 10: Where even when we lose, we have a blast
content: 'Cause there's a spark in you You just gotta ignite the light And let it shine Just own the night Like the Fourth of July 'Caty Perry Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . we believe that it is important to celebrate all life's victories, whether those triumphs be large or be they small .

title: Best stories, wildest celebrations from amazing round of qualifiers
content: the November international break delivered more than its fair share of thrills and spills as more national teams secured their place at the 2026 finals . the break produced a plethora of qualifying drama as tiny nations reached the finals for the first time, last-minute goals decided matches and a handful of major names tumbled by the wayside .

title: Bracketology: Top seedings, bracket watch and more
content: conference tournaments are set to begin later this week . there are 31 automatic bids with 33 at-large teams chosen by the NCAA volleyball committee . the top eight teams in each region serve as first- and second-round hosts .

title: Anthony Yarde hoping third time's a charm in David Benavidez world title showdown
content: Anthony Yarde was stopped by artur Beterbiev and Sergey Kovalev in 2023 and 2019 respectively . the 34-year-old says he will be better in his third attempt at winning a world light heavyweight title on sunday . he was stopped in eight rounds for three versions of the world title, after lasting 11 rounds .

title: Alabama and JMU have something in common: anger about the CFP rankings
content: the ACC and the group of 5 will supply champions, too, whether the Big Ten likes it or not . the winner of a week 13 showdown between USC and Oregon should be on track for a bid . it's hard to imagine that Notre Dame is left out, given its no. 9 ranking .

title: Texas firmly out, Miami in limbo and the G5‚Äôs flavor of the week
content: the new rankings keep Ohio State at the top of the pile, while Texas Tech slides into the no. 5 spot in Week 13 . Notre Dame should buy some furniture and move in . the team's only win against a CFP-ranked team is against no. 15 USC .

title: Let's talk about North Texas -- why the Mean Green is the bet to make in December
content: north Texas is sitting -115 both ways to make or miss the playoff . the committee is reacting to resumes, but not quality wins . UNT has one loss, a 63-36 defensive collapse to south Florida .

title: Updated Power Rankings: 1-32 poll, plus who's under the most pressure for each team
content: we restacked the NFL heading into week 12 . we asked our NFL Nation reporters to pick one player, coach or executive who is under the most pressure for each team . how many picks are the same from when we asked the same question .

title: Which 16 NHL teams will make the playoffs? Projections for all 32 at the quarter mark
content: no team in the east was more than four points out of the wild-card spot . in the west, all but three teams were within three points of a playoff spot. this month, we're also looking at points of concern early this season for teams inside and outside the bubble.

title: Panthers, Rangers reveal Winter Classic jerseys
content: the 17th NHL Winter Classic is scheduled for Jan. 2 at LoanDepot Park . it's the southernmost outdoor game ever played in the NHL . the Panthers' winter Classic jersey references the team's original "leaping panther" logo .

title: Inside the decision that will rock college football: What's next for Kiffin?
content: coach Lane Kiffin says there is no ultimatum for him to make a decision on his coaching future . he posted a photo of a page from Brianna Wiest's self-development book, "the Pivot Year: 365 days to Become the Person You Truly Want to Be" he encouraged readers to make two lists, one of the positivists .

title: MMA P4P rankings: Shevchenko, Makhachev new No. 1s -- but just one unanimous
content: Valentina Shevchenko was no. 2 on the ESPN men's pound-for-pound rankings . the pair ascended to no. 1 after dominant victories at UFC 322 . Makhachev's opponent, Jack Della Maddalena, was ranked eighth among men .

title: Assent to bills timeline: SC hearing President reference today; states back deadlines
content: a five-judge bench of the Supreme Court led by CJI B R Gavai will give its opinion on the reference in which the President has also questioned the use of exclusive powers by SC under Article 142 of the Constitution to grant deemed assent to bills pending with a governor . the reference by the Centre through President was sent to SC on may 14 nearly a month after a bench of justices J B Pardiwala and R Mahadevan took the extraordinary step of granting the assent

title: West Bengal: BLO found dead in Jalpaiguri; family blames SIR stress
content: a 48-year-old ICDS worker was found hanging near her home in the tea estate . her husband, Suku Ekka, has filed an FIR naming the Election Commission of India . she was appointed as a booth level officer in new Glencoe tea estate in malbazar .
